title.native: 寄生獣 セイの格率

description:
They arrive in silence and darkness. They descend from the skies. They have a hunger for human flesh. They are everywhere. They are parasites, alien creatures who must invade–and take control of–a human host to survive. And once they have infected their victims, they can assume any deadly form they choose: monsters with giant teeth, winged demons, creatures with blades for hands. But most have chosen to conceal their lethal purpose behind ordinary human faces. So no one knows their secret–except an ordinary high school student. Shin is battling for control of his own body against an alien parasite, but can he find a way to warn humanity of the horrors to come?

(Source: Del Rey)

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Cannibalism
tags.description: Prominently features the act of consuming another member of the same species as food.

tags.name: Environmental
tags.description: Concern with the state of the natural world and how humans interact with it.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Villainess
tags.description: Centers around or prominently features a villainous noble lady.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

title.native: 寄生獣

name.first: Fear, and Loathing in Las Vegas
name.native: フィアー·アンド·ロージング·イン·ラスベガス

node.description:
[Website](http://www.lasvegas-jp.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Falilv) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/Falilv_Official/)

__Biography__
The band formed in 2008 in Kobe, Japan. Fear, and Loathing in Las Vegas combines electronica and metalcore, further exploring a number of influences from other genres among their discography. The singing is comprised of twin vocals; the destructive shouts of one vocalist contrasts with the autotune of the other, which gives them a presence like no other. In November 2009, their first EP "Burn the Disco Floor with Your 2-step!!" was released.

__Members__
- So - vocal, scream vocal, programming (joined in 2009)
- Minami - vocal, scream vocal, keyboard, programming
- Taiki - guitar, chorus, vocal
- Tomonori - drums
- Tetsuya - bass, chorus, vocal (joined in 2019)

__Former Members__
- Mashu - bass (left on September 21, 2013)
- Sxun - guitar, chorus, vocal (left on June 30, 2018)
- Kei - bass, chorus, vocal (died on January 12, 2019)

name.native: フレデリック・フランソワ・ショパン

node.description: Fryderyk Franciszek Chopin, also known as Frédéric François Chopin, was a Polish composer, virtuoso pianist, and music teacher, of French-Polish parentage. He was one of the great masters of Romantic music.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/156204341) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hiramatz/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/tadashi-hiramatz/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@hiramatz1963)

Affiliated with [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).

Although at first becoming a salary man after graduation, he later decided to become animator and joined Nakamura Production, where he debuted on [Bugtte Honey](https://anilist.co/anime/10210/) in 1987. He later joined Studio Gainax and was involved in the production of [Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/Shin-Seiki-Evangelion/). In 1998 he debuted as character designer of [Kare Kano](https://anilist.co/anime/145/Kareshi-Kanojo-no-Jijou/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/吉成曜) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yoh_Yoshinari) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=yoh_yoshinari)

A Japanese animator, director and storyboard artist currently working at [Trigger](https://anilist.co/studio/803/). Yoshinari entered the anime industry through the influence of his older brother, [Kou Yoshinari](https://anilist.co/staff/102136/). Several of his early works were uncredited second key animation and in-betweens for his brother during high school. After leaving professional school, he applied to [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/) and [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). Not receiving a response from Gainax, he joined Madhouse. Due to a misunderstanding, Gainax failed to process his application until three months later. Not wanting to explain, Yoshinari told Madhouse; "being an animator is too hard for me," and switched to Gainax.

At Gainax, Yoshinari had joined just after the closure of [Nadia: The Secret of Blue Water](https://anilist.co/anime/1251/). With nothing to do, he was immediately put onto visual development for the film [Aoki Uru](https://anilist.co/anime/21430/), although the film’s production was later broken off due to the studio’s financial state. Undoubtedly his breakout as an animator was just a few years later when he served as one of the lead animators in [Neon Genesis Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/). Yoshinari worked at Gainax until leaving for Trigger in 2011, a studio founded by fellow ex-Gainax members, [Hiroyuki Imaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/97349/) and [Masahiko Ootsuka](https://anilist.co/staff/108023/). At Trigger he debuted as a director on [Little Witch Academia](https://anilist.co/anime/14349/).

Yoshinari is recognized by the way he represents volume and perspective using spheres, especially for smoke and explosions, as well as his character action in general. His characters often borrow traits from western animation, such as rectangular heads, low contrast shading, big eyes and angular lineart. He uses expertly timed smears, dramatic camerawork, and complicated background animation to convey dynamism. His movement is springy and tense, cleanly situated in the dominant cartoony style of ‘00s Gainax. He remarks [Nijitte Monogatari](https://anilist.co/manga/112385/) as one of his most important influences, with his artistic style particularly visible in his design work for [Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann](https://anilist.co/anime/2001/) and Little Witch Academia.

Also a big fan of [Osamu Tezuka](https://anilist.co/staff/96938/)’s, having done multiple short [animations](https://anilist.co/anime/123638/) based on his manga characters.

Married to producer [Naoko Tsutsumi](https://anilist.co/staff/150017/).

(Sources: Wikipedia, Anidb, Animators Wiki)

Iwaaki's art is simple, powerful and sensitive, going against the '90s trend towards flashy pictures and vapid plots. He cites Tezuka as his main influence.

In 1993, he received the Kodansha Manga Award for Parasyte, and in 2012 he was awarded the 16th Tezuka Osamu Cultural Prize for Historie.
